name: Agile Methodologies
description: A set of values, principles, and practices that enable teams to deliver value faster and with higher quality.

skills.name: Agile principles and values
skills.description: Mastery of the Agile Manifesto and its underlying principles, and ability to apply them in complex and challenging situations

sub-skills.name: The four values of Agile
sub-skills.description: Mastery of the four values that underpin the Agile Manifesto, and ability to balance them in dynamic and changing environments

sub-skills.name: The twelve principles of Agile
sub-skills.description: Mastery of the twelve principles that underpin the Agile Manifesto, and ability to apply them in complex and challenging situations

skills.name: Scrum framework
skills.description: Mastery of Scrum roles, events, artifacts, and their interactions, and ability to customize them to fit the needs of the team and the organization

sub-skills.name: Scrum roles
sub-skills.description: Mastery of the three Scrum roles and their responsibilities, and ability to coach and mentor others in their implementation

sub-skills.name: Scrum events
sub-skills.description: Mastery of the five Scrum events and their purpose, and ability to facilitate them effectively and efficiently

sub-skills.name: Scrum artifacts
sub-skills.description: Mastery of the three Scrum artifacts and their purpose, and ability to use them as a means of communication and collaboration

skills.name: User stories
skills.description: Ability to write effective and efficient user stories, and ability to coach and mentor others in their implementation

sub-skills.name: Independent
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that can be completed independently of other stories, and ability to design systems that allow for their implementation

sub-skills.name: Negotiable
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that can be refined or changed over time, and ability to facilitate their negotiation with stakeholders and team members

sub-skills.name: Valuable
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that deliver value to the customer, and ability to design systems that maximize their value

sub-skills.name: Estimable
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that can be estimated, and ability to use estimation techniques to improve the accuracy and reliability of the estimates

sub-skills.name: Small
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that are small enough to be completed in a single development iteration, and ability to design systems that allow for their implementation

sub-skills.name: Testable
sub-skills.description: Ability to write user stories that can be tested and verified, and ability to design systems that facilitate their testing

skills.name: Agile planning and estimation
skills.description: Ability to plan and estimate work items in an Agile project, and ability to coach and mentor others in their implementation

sub-skills.name: Task creation
sub-skills.description: Ability to break down user stories into actionable tasks, and ability to design systems that facilitate their creation and management

sub-skills.name: Estimation
sub-skills.description: Ability to estimate the effort required for a given task or user story, and ability to use estimation techniques to improve the accuracy and reliability of the estimates

sub-skills.name: Prioritization
sub-skills.description: Ability to prioritize user stories or tasks based on business value, technical dependencies, or other criteria, and ability to use prioritization techniques to optimize value delivery

skills.name: Agile team collaboration
skills.description: Ability to collaborate effectively within an Agile team and with stakeholders, and ability to coach and mentor others in their implementation

sub-skills.name: Communication
sub-skills.description: Ability to communicate effectively within the team and with stakeholders, using advanced techniques like non-violent communication and active listening

sub-skills.name: Collaboration
sub-skills.description: Ability to work collaboratively within the team and across functional areas, using advanced techniques like facilitation, conflict resolution, and consensus building

sub-skills.name: Self-organization
sub-skills.description: Ability to work in a self-organizing team environment, where team members are empowered to make decisions and take ownership of their work, and ability to coach and mentor others in their implementation

skills.name: Agile technical practices
skills.description: Ability to apply Agile technical practices to software development, and ability to coach and mentor others in their implementation

sub-skills.name: Continuous integration
sub-skills.description: Ability to set up and maintain a complex continuous integration pipeline, using advanced techniques like pipeline visualization, automated testing, and parallelization

sub-skills.name: Test-driven development
sub-skills.description: Ability to write high-quality automated tests before writing code, using advanced techniques like behavior-driven development, mutation testing, and property-based testing

sub-skills.name: Refactoring
sub-skills.description: Ability to refactor complex and legacy code to improve its design, maintainability, and extensibility, using advanced techniques like microservices, domain-driven design, and aspect-oriented programming
